content:
L1: 3-Bromopyridine (7.18 g 44 mmol) and D4 Vi (3.92 g, 11 mmol) were kept under nitrogen in a 250 mL two neck round-bottom flask, equipped with magnetic stirrer and reflux condenser. The flask was purged with nitrogen for 15 min at room temperature, and then 15 mL of triethylamine and Pd­[P­(tBu3)2] (20 mg, 0.1 mmol) were added. The reaction mixture was then stirred at 90 °C for 96 h. After cooling to room temperature, hexane (50 mL) was added, and the mixture was washed with water in a separating funnel. The organic layer was separated, filtered through Celite, and evaporated in vacuum, to yield 60% of the crude L1 as a yellowish-brown oily compound. The crude mixture was purified by column chromatography using tetrahydrofuran and chloroform (20:80) as eluent which gave three stereoisomers of L1, namely, the cis–trans–cis L1A, cis–cis–trans L1B, and all-trans L1C, in the respective 35, 60, and 5% compositions.

1: To a solution of L1A (10 mg, 0.015 mmol) in THF (1 mL), kept in a 10 cm long glass tube, was slowly layered a methanolic solution of ZnI2 (10 mg, 0.031 mmol). The layered solutions in the tube were kept at room temperature for 2 days to get colorless crystals of 1. FT-IR data in powdered sample (cm–1): 2956, 2924, 1605, 1581, 1482, 1432, 1262, 1193, 1135, 1062, 799, 700, 655. Anal. Calcd for C32H36Zn2­I4N4O4Si4: C, 29.76; H, 2.81; N, 4.34. Found: C, 29.65; H, 2.73; N, 4.40.

2: To a solution of L1B (12 mg, 0.018 mmol) in DCM (3 mL), kept in a 10 cm long glass tube, was added toluene (1 mL) followed by a careful layering of a solution of AgNO3 (6 mg, 0.036 mmol) in water (3 mL). The resulting slightly cloudy solution was kept in the dark for crystallization. Colorless crystals were obtained after 4 days. FT-IR data in powdered sample (cm–1): 2955, 2922, 1598, 1478, 1427, 1261, 1192, 1086, 1033, 853, 795, 702, 649. Anal. Calcd for C33H42­Ag2N6O12Si4: C, 38.01; H, 4.06; N, 8.06. Found: C, 38.35; H, 3.95; N, 8.20.

3: To a solution of L2C (10 mg, 0.015 mmol) in DCM (1 mL), kept in 10 cm long glass tube, was slowly layered CuI solution in acetonitrile (10 mg, 0.06 mmol). The layered solutions in the tube were kept at room temperature for 7 days to get colorless crystals of 3. FT-IR data in powdered sample (cm–1): 2955, 2922, 1598, 1478, 1427, 1261, 1192, 1086, 1033, 853, 795, 702, 649. Anal. Calcd for C32H44Cu4I4­N4O4Si4: C, 27.01; H, 3.12; N, 3.94. Found: C, 27.15; H, 3.20; N, 3.79.

Syntheses

L1: 3-Bromopyridine (7.18 g 44 mmol) and D4 Vi (3.92 g, 11 mmol) were kept under nitrogen in a 250 mL two neck round-bottom flask, equipped with magnetic stirrer and reflux condenser. The flask was purged with nitrogen for 15 min at room temperature, and then 15 mL of triethylamine and Pd[P(tBu3)2] (20 mg, 0.1 mmol) were added. The reaction mixture was then stirred at 90 °C for 96 h. After cooling to room temperature, hexane (50 mL) was added, and the mixture was washed with water in a separating funnel. The organic layer was separated, filtered through Celite, and evaporated in vacuum, to yield 60% of the crude L1 as a yellowish-brown oily compound. The crude mixture was purified by column chromatography using tetrahydrofuran and chloroform (20:80) as eluent which gave three stereoisomers of L1, namely, the cis-trans-cis L1A, cis-cis-trans L1B, and all-trans L1C, in the respective 35, 60, and 5% compositions.

 1: To a solution of L1A (10 mg, 0.015 mmol) in THF (1 mL), kept in a 10 cm long glass tube, was slowly layered a methanolic solution of ZnI2 (10 mg, 0.031 mmol). The layered solutions in the tube were kept at room temperature for 2 days to get colorless crystals of 1. FT-IR data in powdered sample (cm-1): 2956, 2924, 1605, 1581, 1482, 1432, 1262, 1193, 1135, 1062, 799, 700, 655. Anal. Calcd for C32H36Zn2I4N4O4Si4: C, 29.76; H, 2.81; N, 4.34. Found: C, 29.65; H, 2.73; N, 4.40.

 2: To a solution of L1B (12 mg, 0.018 mmol) in DCM (3 mL), kept in a 10 cm long glass tube, was added toluene (1 mL) followed by a careful layering of a solution of AgNO3 (6 mg, 0.036 mmol) in water (3 mL). The resulting slightly cloudy solution was kept in the dark for crystallization. Colorless crystals were obtained after 4 days. FT-IR data in powdered sample (cm-1): 2955, 2922, 1598, 1478, 1427, 1261, 1192, 1086, 1033, 853, 795, 702, 649. Anal. Calcd for C33H42Ag2N6O12Si4: C, 38.01; H, 4.06; N, 8.06. Found: C, 38.35; H, 3.95; N, 8.20.

 3: To a solution of L2C (10 mg, 0.015 mmol) in DCM (1 mL), kept in 10 cm long glass tube, was slowly layered CuI solution in acetonitrile (10 mg, 0.06 mmol). The layered solutions in the tube were kept at room temperature for 7 days to get colorless crystals of 3. FT-IR data in powdered sample (cm-1): 2955, 2922, 1598, 1478, 1427, 1261, 1192, 1086, 1033, 853, 795, 702, 649. Anal. Calcd for C32H44Cu4I4N4O4Si4: C, 27.01; H, 3.12; N, 3.94.
